radiographic_examinations.findings: 2 ring-enhancing lesions, one in the left parietal region and one in the right occipital lobe.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased size of the parietal and occipital lesions, and several additional lesions seen on subsequent MRI performed ∼22 days after initial presentation.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Low-density left parietal lobe brain lesion.
Multiple new enhancing lesions in the right and cerebellar hemispheres.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Several MRIs showed no change in the number and size of lesions over the next ∼3 months.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Increasing CNS lesions (in number and size).
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Gradual resolution of the surrounding edema but persistence of 2 ring-enhancing lesions, decreasing in size from 3.5 and 3.0 cm to 2.4 and 2.7 cm, respectively.

radiographic_examinations.findings: No new lesions; slight decrease in size of existing lesions.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Continued decrease in the size and enhancement of the numerous lesions over time.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Edema in the left temporal/parietal area of the brain.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up MRI performed 19 days later demonstrated 2 large ring-enhancing lesions surrounded by edema.

radiographic_examinations.date: 70 days after initial presentation for the 5-year-old girl
radiographic_examinations.findings: Distinct encapsulated lesion in the left parietal lobe that enhances with surrounding edema.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: MRI/CT showed persistent 2 lesions, with partial calcification; resolution of surrounding edema.
